verses.kjv: Then sang Moses and the children of Israel this song unto the LORD, and spake, saying, I will sing unto the LORD, for he hath triumphed gloriously: the horse and his rider hath he thrown into the sea.
verses.ct: Then Moses and the people of Israel sang this song to the LORD: "I will sing to the LORD, because he has won a magnificent victory — the horse and its rider he has hurled into the sea.

verses.kjv: The LORD is my strength and song, and he is become my salvation: he is my God, and I will prepare him an habitation; my father’s God, and I will exalt him.
verses.ct: The LORD is my strength and my song, and he has become my salvation. He is my God, and I will build a dwelling place for him; he is the God of my father, and I will lift him up in praise.

verses.kjv: The LORD is a man of war: the LORD is his name.
verses.ct: The LORD is a warrior — the LORD is his name.

verses.kjv: Pharaoh’s chariots and his host hath he cast into the sea: his chosen captains also are drowned in the Red sea.
verses.ct: He has thrown Pharaoh's chariots and army into the sea. Pharaoh's finest officers have drowned in the Red Sea.

verses.kjv: The depths have covered them: they sank into the bottom as a stone.
verses.ct: The deep waters swallowed them up; they sank to the bottom like a stone.

verses.kjv: Thy right hand, O LORD, is become glorious in power: thy right hand, O LORD, hath dashed in pieces the enemy.
verses.ct: Your right hand, LORD, is magnificent in power. Your right hand, LORD, has shattered the enemy.

verses.kjv: And in the greatness of thine excellency thou hast overthrown them that rose up against thee: thou sentest forth thy wrath, which consumed them as stubble.
verses.ct: In your overwhelming majesty, you toppled those who stood against you. You unleashed your burning anger, and it consumed them like dry straw.

verses.kjv: And with the blast of thy nostrils the waters were gathered together, the floods stood upright as an heap, and the depths were congealed in the heart of the sea.
verses.ct: At the blast of your breath, the waters piled up. The rushing waters stood firm like a wall, and the deep waters became solid in the middle of the sea.

verses.kjv: The enemy said, I will pursue, I will overtake, I will divide the spoil; my lust shall be satisfied upon them; I will draw my sword, my hand shall destroy them.
verses.ct: The enemy said, 'I will chase them down, I will catch them, I will divide up what they own. I will have my fill of them. I will pull out my sword, and my own hand will destroy them.'

verses.kjv: Thou didst blow with thy wind, the sea covered them: they sank as lead in the mighty waters.
verses.ct: But you blew with your wind, and the sea closed over them. They sank like lead in the powerful waters.

verses.kjv: Who is like unto thee, O LORD, among the gods? who is like thee, glorious in holiness, fearful in praises, doing wonders?
verses.ct: Who among the gods is like you, LORD? Who is like you — magnificent in holiness, awesome in praise, performing wonders?

verses.kjv: Thou stretchedst out thy right hand, the earth swallowed them.
verses.ct: You stretched out your right hand, and the earth swallowed them.

verses.kjv: Thou in thy mercy hast led forth the people which thou hast redeemed: thou hast guided them in thy strength unto thy holy habitation.
verses.ct: In your mercy, you have led the people you rescued. In your strength, you have guided them to your holy dwelling place.

verses.kjv: The people shall hear, and be afraid: sorrow shall take hold on the inhabitants of Palestina.
verses.ct: The nations will hear about this and tremble. Anguish will grip the people of Philistia.

verses.kjv: Then the dukes of Edom shall be amazed; the mighty men of Moab, trembling shall take hold upon them; all the inhabitants of Canaan shall melt away.
verses.ct: The chiefs of Edom will be stunned. The leaders of Moab will shake with fear. Every inhabitant of Canaan will lose all courage.

verses.kjv: Fear and dread shall fall upon them; by the greatness of thine arm they shall be as still as a stone; till thy people pass over, O LORD, till the people pass over, which thou hast purchased.
verses.ct: Terror and dread will overwhelm them. Because of the power of your arm, they will stand frozen like stone — until your people pass through, LORD, until the people you have claimed pass through.

verses.kjv: Thou shalt bring them in, and plant them in the mountain of thine inheritance, in the place, O LORD, which thou hast made for thee to dwell in, in the Sanctuary, O LORD, which thy hands have established.
verses.ct: You will bring them in and establish them on the mountain that is your inheritance, the place you have made as your home, LORD — the sanctuary, LORD, that your hands have built.

verses.kjv: The LORD shall reign for ever and ever.
verses.ct: The LORD will reign forever and ever."

verses.kjv: For the horse of Pharaoh went in with his chariots and with his horsemen into the sea, and the LORD brought again the waters of the sea upon them; but the children of Israel went on dry land in the midst of the sea.
verses.ct: When Pharaoh's horses, chariots, and horsemen charged into the sea, the LORD brought the waters crashing back over them. But the people of Israel had walked through on dry ground right in the middle of the sea.

verses.kjv: And Miriam the prophetess, the sister of Aaron, took a timbrel in her hand; and all the women went out after her with timbrels and with dances.
verses.ct: Then Miriam the prophetess, Aaron's sister, picked up a tambourine, and all the women followed her with tambourines, dancing.

verses.kjv: And Miriam answered them, Sing ye to the LORD, for he hath triumphed gloriously; the horse and his rider hath he thrown into the sea.
verses.ct: Miriam sang out to them, "Sing to the LORD, because he has won a magnificent victory — the horse and its rider he has hurled into the sea."

verses.kjv: So Moses brought Israel from the Red sea, and they went out into the wilderness of Shur; and they went three days in the wilderness, and found no water.
verses.ct: Moses then led Israel away from the Red Sea, and they traveled into the wilderness of Shur. They journeyed for 3 days through the wilderness without finding any water.

verses.kjv: And when they came to Marah, they could not drink of the waters of Marah, for they were bitter: therefore the name of it was called Marah.
verses.ct: When they arrived at Marah, they couldn't drink the water there because it was bitter. That is why the place was named Marah.

verses.kjv: And the people murmured against Moses, saying, What shall we drink?
verses.ct: The people complained to Moses, saying, "What are we supposed to drink?"

verses.kjv: And he cried unto the LORD; and the LORD shewed him a tree, which when he had cast into the waters, the waters were made sweet: there he made for them a statute and an ordinance, and there he proved them,
verses.ct: So Moses cried out to the LORD, and the LORD showed him a piece of wood. When he threw it into the water, the water became drinkable. It was there that God established a law and a regulation for them, and there he tested them.

verses.kjv: And said, If thou wilt diligently hearken to the voice of the LORD thy God, and wilt do that which is right in his sight, and wilt give ear to his commandments, and keep all his statutes, I will put none of these diseases upon thee, which I have brought upon the Egyptians: for I am the LORD that healeth thee.
verses.ct: He said, "If you carefully listen to the voice of the LORD your God, do what is right in his eyes, pay attention to his commands, and follow all his regulations, I will not bring on you any of the diseases I brought on the Egyptians. For I am the LORD who heals you."

verses.kjv: And they came to Elim, where were twelve wells of water, and threescore and ten palm trees: and they encamped there by the waters.
verses.ct: Then they arrived at Elim, where there were 12 springs of water and 70 palm trees. They set up camp there beside the water.
